meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm here to give you the lowdown on Chants of Sennaar, a puzzle-adventure game that's all about using language to connect ancient civilizations. But before I dive in, let me just say that I'm not exactly a linguistics expert. In fact, my high school French consists of "Bonjour, comment ça va?" and that's it. But hey, who needs fluency when you have Google Translate, right?

Now, onto the game! Chants of Sennaar is all about using ancient languages to uncover hidden secrets and solve puzzles. It's a bit like being an archaeologist, but instead of digging up artifacts, you're deciphering cryptic messages and ancient texts.

The critics seem to agree that this game is a real brain-twister (sorry, had to). Slant Magazine calls it "academic" and says it feels like a linguistic anthropology lesson – not exactly the most exciting thing in the world. But hey, if you're into that sorta thing, go for it!

Worth Playing agrees that it's a puzzle-adventure game at heart, with some seriously challenging puzzles to solve. And let me tell you, those stealth elements? Solid mechanics and quick restarts make for a tense and thrilling experience.

SpazioGames loves the game's immersion factor – it's like being directly involved in myths and legends! You get to connect ancient populations through the power of words. (Okay, maybe not exactly, but that sounds cool, right?)

God is a Geek calls it "one of the most unique and interesting puzzle games I've ever played" – high praise indeed! And Hardcore Gamer agrees that it's an immensely clever game that turns translation into a captivating bit of gameplay.

TheSixthAxis thinks Chants of Sennaar does a great job exploring the relations between different groups of people, highlighting both differences and similarities. It's a puzzle game that deserves attention!

Noisy Pixel wraps up by saying there aren't many experiences quite like Chants of Sennaar – it's linguistic gameplay that's simple to understand but complex to solve. And let me tell you, I'm intrigued.

So what's my take on this game? Well, I think it's a real hoot! Okay, maybe not exactly, but I do think it's a great way to learn about ancient languages and cultures while having fun solving puzzles. Who knows, maybe I'll even pick up some French along the way...

That's all for now – Hippo Penny out!
